basics.name: Adeil Mohammadzadah
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computer Science from the University of Minnesota - Twin Cities. I am currently doing an exchange semester at the University of Hawaii - Manoa. I expect to graduate in Dec 2024.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa (Exchange Semester)

highlights: Facilitated learning in key business technologies (Excel, Tableau, HTML) by grading and providing feedback on student projects, helping students apply IT-enabled business models and perform data-driven analysis to solve business challenges.

Led discussions and mentored students on using technology to develop real-world business strategies, fostering strategic thinking, collaboration, and technical problem-solving applicable to cross-functional product management.
Innovated inventory management by designing and implementing a mobile-based system to track furniture using barcodes, reducing stock management errors and improving operational efficiency by 20%.
Led cross-functional advertising campaigns that increased store traffic and sales by 35% by leveraging Google Ads and Facebook for targeted customer outreach.

Conducted a comprehensive assessment of enterprise data quality and gave a final presentation to key stakeholders, presenting findings and actionable recommendations that shaped future data management policies and automation improvements.

Collaborated with a team to improve data literacy across the enterprise by compiling a comprehensive list of key data-related terms, which was later published on the company website to serve as a resource for employees.

work.company: University of Minnesota - College of Liberal Arts
highlights: Led a team of five in conducting qualitative surveys on topics like campus safety and retention, analyzing data, and preparing visual reports with actionable insights for university administration. Improved decision-making efficiency by providing data-driven recommendations.

Collaborated with cross-functional teams to present survey findings, aligning key stakeholders (faculty, administration, student services) on actionable strategies for improving student retention and safety on campus.
Led students in coding their own games using Python and Java during intensive 5-day programming workshops, combining hands-on learning with core programming concepts to build functional projects.
